item.title: The Struggle with Prefix Syntax
item.description: If you’re programming in a Lisp-family programming language, working with numbers is going to be a little bit different. Some might say that, while it may seem odd at first, you can get used to it. That is to say, it’s not bad. Just… different. Prefix means that where you would normally have the operator between operands, you would have only one operator at the very beginning. In my experience, this is fine for when you need to add or multiply.
